comment.body:
If anyone interested to know what the "--multiuser_local" parameter mean/why is important, [here](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1521308711_128dbVaHobAMsFW25rUVyFxwdCvvfkidzT#comment_1141_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj) it is explained.

And here is similar tutorial for the completness: [Using the Multiuser plugin](/eventi.bit/?Post:3:Using+the+Multiuser+plugin)
thank you for a nice tutorial, mostly i find things using [ZeroHello](/) search or create new topic on [Zerotalk](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/).

Hi, some people post large data on sites like ZeroUp or their own blogs and link their articles/data from ZeroTalk (create new ZeroTalk topic to attract attention).
Some times i created ZeroTalk topic just to mention link and a few keywords so people can find the post via ZeroHello search functionality.

> [thunder33345](#comment_6_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): so you recommend i should post onto zerotalk too?

I would find related topics on ZeroTalk using ZeroHello search feature "Search in connected sites" (example query: bandwidth speed site:zerotalk) and if not found, maybe compose new ZeroTalk topic where i shortly sumarize my thoughts and link to full articles discussions on UnlimitTalk or here.

BTW: if you are reaching your limit on ZeroTalk, you will see contact e-mail of the nofish who can raise your limit. He did once for me and once without me asking.
@thunder33345 thx for the feedback. Hopefuly your articles will now be easier to be found.
